Marcelo Garcia side control attacks 3 High Percentage Sweeps Every Master Should Use TUDO SOBRE MEIA GUARDA COM BERNARDO FARIA | #13 The Art of Escaping Side Control by Ryan Hall Understanding the Closed Guard with Michelle Nicolini Effective Chokes from Half Guard with Saulo Ribeiro Advanced Butterfly Guard Techniques with Garry Tonon The Importance of Base in BJJ by John Danaher Drilling the Kimura from Various Positions with Andre Galvao
29 Dec 2025

Side control attacks

  • Hips on top of his foot (otherwise he will escape)
  • Keep right leg hook otherwise he can pass my guard
  • My right leg hook should be behind the knees. If it is on the heel, he can easily takes out, although I have more leverage.
  • Do not hold the collar, hold the cross sleeve (his right sleeve)
  • Take out my left leg when he drops, and do levantada tecnica. After the sweep, hold both legs and then levantada tecnica
  • Control the bottom leg when he drops, otherwise he will come to the top.
  • If his left leg is very far for me to reach, I should not extend a lot cause I am weak like that. Instead, I should reverse tripod sweep

5 DETALHES DA BOTINHA:

a. Nao abrace com todo o braco, pois tem muito musculo. Apenas a metade do braco.

b. Segura a gola oposta, to be tight. Use the other hand to feed

c. Thumbs up, to use the sharp part of the forearms.

d. Close the elbows

e. Make the grips strong
DLR guard basics
7 Nov 2025

DLR sweeps

  • In the 80s, by master Ricardo Delariva, from Rio, used to control the distance and avoid being smashed by bigger oponnents.
  • It starts griping his foot, in two ways: grabbing the heel, or grabbing the pants (explain difference)
  • You put a hook later. My hooked leg I have to push to the right, with the knees closed. If it is opened, it is easy for him to push my knee down and break the hook. My hips should be close to his foot.
  • Right leg should be active, it creates distance, or pull him to me.
  • Right hand can go in different places, I’ll put in the the collar. Important to have connections
DLR guard basics
2 Nov 2025

Tripod sweep - Ankle Lock

  • In the 80s, by master Ricardo Delariva, from Rio, used to control the distance and avoid being smashed by bigger oponnents.
  • It starts griping his foot, in two ways: grabbing the heel, or grabbing the pants (explain difference)
  • You put a hook later. My hooked leg I have to push to the right, with the knees closed. If it is opened, it is easy for him to push my knee down and break the hook. My hips should be close to his foot.
  • Right leg should be active, it creates distance, or pull him to me.
  • Right hand can go in different places, I’ll put in the the collar. Important to have connections
